name: Ext.Manifest
doc:
This is not a real JavaScript class and cannot be created. This is for documentation purposes only.

This documentation is for Ext.manifest

members.name: compatibility
members.doc: An object keyed by package name with the value being to desired compatibility level as a version number. If this is just a string, this version is assumed to apply to the framework. Setting this value to less than 5 for 'ext' will enable the compatibility layer to assist in the application upgrade process. For details on the upgrade process, see the (Upgrade Guide)[#/guides/upgrade_50].
members.short_doc:
An object keyed by package name with the value being to desired compatibility level as a
version number. ...
members.html_type: String/Object

members.name: debug
members.doc: An object configuring the debugging characteristics of the framework. See Ext.debugConfig which is set to this value.
members.short_doc: An object configuring the debugging characteristics of the framework. ...

members.name: mashup
members.doc:
An object that allows developers to pass values into templates used to populate requiredScripts.

Here is an example of passing a key along to Ext.ux.google.Map.

 "mashup": {
     "map": {  // the xtype
         "key": "[GOOGLE_MAPS_KEY]"
     }
 }
members.short_doc:
An object that allows developers to pass values into templates used to populate
requiredScripts. ...

members.name: packages
members.doc: An object keyed by package name with the value being a subset of the package's "package.json" descriptor.

short_doc: This is not a real JavaScript class and cannot be created. ...
